nodes.bodyText: Just a Counter should suffice? We can calculate everything else ourselves
Do we need to pass the CassandraClientPoolingContainer if it's unused?
I did this more for consistency with the existing methods. Though yeah it might be worth not passing it to not give people the impression that it would be reported
I don't think connections get dropped, they still retry. Maybe "AtlasDB now publishes a metric that can be used to monitor Cassandra connection pool exhaustion."
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+type: improvement
+improvement:
+  description: AtlasDB now publishes a metric indicating the count of requests that
+    were dropped owing to saturated Cassandra connection pools.

nodes.bodyText: Yep, it's a bit confusing - it's the count of requests internal to the Cassandra client pool that are dropped. At a higher level (i.e. CassandraClientPool as opposed to the individual pooling container) they will get retried.
